You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint. If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 4 Actions.

Increase your Insight Rank to 3 (d10).

Courtier

Once per Waypoint, you may invoke your dipmoatic staus to avoid arrest or legal consequences for minor offenses.

You are an expert at arranging advantageous deals and alliances, leveraging your noble prowess to gain favors and resources.
At the beginning of a Waypoint when you are in a city, you may spend 2 Momentum to gain 1 Favor and 1 Wealth.

You excel at forming discrete alliances ensuring mutual benefits without drawing unwanted attention, allowing you to add 1d+ Bonus Hits to any result set when you Persuade or use your Insight in a private meeting.

You maintain a network of informants and are skilled at finding enterprising local to gather valuable intelligence. You may spend Wealth while in a city and ask the BAMF X questions, where X is the amount of Wealth spent. Then, Deceive your informants to cover your tracks.
The BAMF will provide your answers at a time that makes sense in the game fiction.

Increase your History Rank to 2 (d8) and your Persuasion or Insight Rank to 2 (d8).

Create an Advantage
Describe a way to use a Skill quickly to aid in your allies efforts.

Roll up to Challenge to create a number of Advantages in the Current Zone equal to the total Hits in the result set.
Use an Advantage
Bonus Hits: Add +1d4 Bonus Hits to any roll.
Trigger a talent: Automatically use a Trigger Talent.
Ignore a Hazard: Remove 1 Hazard die from your next roll.
Re-roll a 1: Re-roll a single die in a result set that landed on 1.
Calm the chaos: Reduce the current Entropy by 1.
Initiate a Contest
You issue a challenge to a single enemy to engage you one on one. If they take up your Challenge, you enter into a Contest.
Wait for it. . .
Prepare an Action until a certain condition is met, such as when an enemy enters their current Zone or an ally lights the wagon on fire. The player declares the Action and associated condition, then waits to make the roll to attempt the Action.
